return_separately.speaker: Narrator
return_separately.text: Elena sits in her corner booth. Thomas enters moments later and hesitates at the counter. They're both here, but neither approaches the other.

elena_ignoring.speaker: Narrator
elena_ignoring.text: Elena stares pointedly out the window. Thomas orders at the counter, stealing glances her direction. The silence between them fills the entire cafe.

tension_breaks.speaker: Thomas
tension_breaks.text: *Finally, he can't take it anymore* You can't keep avoiding me forever, Elena. We live in the same town. We-

elena_snaps.speaker: Elena
elena_snaps.text: *She whirls on him* I avoided you for five years. I can avoid you for fifty more. You made your choice, Thomas. You believed HER over your own sister!

thomas_defends.speaker: Thomas
thomas_defends.text: She was my wife! What was I supposed to do? Take your side against my own wife?

elena_bitter.speaker: Elena
elena_bitter.text: *Bitterly* The truth, Thomas. You were supposed to see the truth. That she manipulated everyone. That she drove a wedge between us on purpose. That she took EVERYTHING!

thomas_regret.speaker: Thomas
thomas_regret.text: *His voice drops* I know. I know that now. Why do you think she left me? Once there was nothing left to take, no more family to isolate me from... she was gone.

elena_shocked.speaker: Elena
elena_shocked.text: *A flash of surprise breaks through her anger* She... left you?

thomas_admits.speaker: Thomas
thomas_admits.text: Two years ago. Took everything she could carry and vanished. And I sat in an empty house, with no wife, no sister, no family... realizing I'd been a fool.

elena_conflicted.speaker: Elena
elena_conflicted.text: *Her anger wavers, replaced by something more complicated* That doesn't... that doesn't make up for what you said. What you did. You called me jealous. Petty. You said I couldn't stand to see you happy.

thomas_shame.speaker: Thomas
thomas_shame.text: *He covers his face* I know. I was blind, Elena. Completely blind. And by the time I could see... you were gone. You'd moved away. Changed your number.

elena_guards.speaker: Elena
elena_guards.text: *Her walls come back up, but there are cracks now* Don't expect me to feel sorry for you. *She pauses* But I won't... I won't avoid the cafe because you're here.

small_progress.speaker: Narrator
small_progress.text: It's not forgiveness. It's not reconciliation. But it's the first time they've been in the same room without one of them leaving. Perhaps that's a start.
